abstract: The former deputy mayor of New York takes over day-to-day duties of his old boss’s sprawling media company.
snippet: The former deputy mayor of New York takes over day-to-day duties of his old boss’s sprawling media company.
lead_paragraph: Daniel L. Doctoroff, a former deputy to MayorMichael Bloomberg of New York who became president of Bloomberg L.P. three and a half years ago, was promoted on Tuesday to be the company’s chief executive.

headline.main: Doctoroff Named Chief Executive of Bloomberg L.P.

abstract: Three new financial thrillers are all worth a read, but some are more realistic than others. Here is DealBook’s take.
snippet: Three new financial thrillers are all worth a read, but some are more realistic than others. Here is DealBook’s take.
lead_paragraph: A recent DealBook article examined Wall Street’s fictional portrayal in three new financial thrillers: David T. Lender’s “Bull Street,” H.T. Narea’s “The Fund” and Norb Vonnegut’s “The Gods of Greenwich.” All three books are worth a read, but the discerning Wall Street reader may find some more realistic than others. DealBook breaks down the relative merits of each:

headline.main: How Realistic Are Wall Street Thrillers?
